articles.title: DPRK SPA to Convene Its Session on April 7
articles.content:
DPRK SPA to Convene Its Session on April 7
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The fourth session of the 12th SPA of the DPRK will be held in Pyongyang on April 7, Juche 100 (2011).
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK made public a decision on it on Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to 9th Congress of Lao Party
articles.content:
Greetings to 9th Congress of Lao Party
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the 9th Congress of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party on Thursday.
					 The message expressed the conviction that the congress would mark an important occasion in its activities to strengthen the unity and cohesion of the party, the army and the people and to achieve the development and prosperity of the country along the road of socialism.
					
					 Hoping that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and the two peoples would grow stronger in the joint struggle against imperialism and for socialism, it wished the congress great success.

articles.title: 13th Kimilsungia Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
13th Kimilsungia Festival to Be Held
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The 13th Kimilsungia Festival will be held here with splendor on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 It will start from the middle of April at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition. Armed forces organs, ministries, national institutions, servicepersons, working people from all walks of life, the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other overseas compatriots' organizations and foreigners will take part in the festival. 
					
					 During the festival Kimilsungia shows are to be held at Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia hothouses in local areas, drawing visitors.

articles.title: Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Russian Ambassador Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery Sukhinin hosted a reception at his embassy on Friday to mark the 62nd anniversary of the conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and Russia.
					 Among those present on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.
					
					 Staff members of the Russian embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Japan in Serious Danger of Large Radioactive Substance Leakage
articles.content:
Japan in Serious Danger of Large Radioactive Substance Leakage
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The danger of radioactive substance leakage is increasing in Japan due to the unceasing explosions of nuclear reactors and fires in the wake of killer quake and the ensuing tsunami. 
					Meltdown occurred at Reactors No. 1, No. 2, No. 3 and No. 4 of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant causing radioactive substance leakage. This is leading to the destruction of the containment vessel. 
					
					All the outer walls of Reactors No. 1, No. 2 and No. 3 burst and the containment vessels of Reactors No. 2 and 3 were damaged.
					
					A spokesman for the Tokyo Electric Power Co. expressed concern that spent fuel rods of Reactor No. 4 might spark off nuclear fission chain reaction.
					
					Meanwhile, the water temperature keeps rising at Reactors No. 5 and No. 6 due to the trouble in the cooling system. They had been under maintenance when the quake struck the area.
					
					The director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency said at a press conference that the situation at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant ''continues to be serious'' due to large radioactive substance leakage.
					
					The U.S. took a measure to test foods from Japan for radioactivity in the wake of Thailand, Singapore and other Asian countries.
					
					Meanwhile, the Japan Police Agency made public that the quake death toll swelled to 6,405 and 10 259 reported missing as of 11:30 of Friday.

articles.title: Agricultural Research Center
articles.content:
Agricultural Research Center
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Much effort has been directed to putting the agricultural production on a scientific and IT basis in the DPRK.
					 The Research Center for Agricultural Information and Technology regularly provides forecasts for the crop growth as well as weather condition, measures for manuring and cultivating crops and methods of exterminating harmful insects.
					
					 The center has renewed the yield estimating method and the farm management programme necessary for agricultural farms to place their farming processes and planning on a scientific basis. 
					
					 It has also built database of field map and agricultural technologies to help farms do farming in a scientific way.

articles.title: New Seafood Store in Pyongyang
articles.content:
New Seafood Store in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Pothonggang Department Store in Pyongyang has an auxiliary building for seafood sale.
					 The seafood store sells sandfish, squid, shellfish and other marine products.
					
					 It also has large water tanks and aquariums for carp, snakehead, flatfish and other species of fish.
					
					 The store was built some time ago to provide fresh fish to citizens.

articles.title: Light Industry Factories Undergo Technological Updating
articles.content:
Light Industry Factories Undergo Technological Updating
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Technological innovations have been made at light industry factories throughout the DPRK.
					 The Sinuiju Textile Mill has made a hydraulic injector and the Sariwon Textile Mill has reconditioned the drawing and other processes.
					
					 The Chongjin Shoes Factory has employed modern equipment to improve the quality of products and increase the productivity.
					
					 The Hamhung Shoes Factory has streamlined the shoemaking processes, while the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory has expanded the production capacity.
					
					 The Changsong Foodstuff Factory has established a new spore culture system in a short period and renewed the soya and bean paste production processes.
					
					 The Jongbangsan Combined Foodstuff Factory has streamlined the candy production process and installed an automatic temperature sensor in the cake stove.

articles.title: Pyongyang Takes on New Look
articles.content:
Pyongyang Takes on New Look
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- A new greening project has been launched in Pyongyang in spring.
					 Roadside trees have been replaced with a new species of willow and large flower beds of different shapes have appeared on either side of streets.
					
					 Evergreens have also been planted along streets to add to the winter scenery.
					
					 The trees and flowers are arranged in a three-dimensional way.

articles.title: City Lying in Park
articles.content:
City Lying in Park
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang has many parks, including Mangyongdae, Taesongsan and Moranbong parks.
					 The parks include Korean wrestling (ssirum), swinging, seesawing and angling sites, amusement facilities, animal sheds, arboretums and greenhouses.
					
					 Pavilions, public catering facilities, artificial waterfalls, flowerpots, fountains, light decorations and animal sculptures are also seen in harmony at the parks.
					
					 The fountain park in front of the Mansudae Art Theatre reminds one of the Mt. Kumgang scenery.
					
					 When visiting Pyongyang some time ago, AP President Thomas Curley admired the city with many parks.

articles.title: High-yielding Fruit Trees Planted
articles.content:
High-yielding Fruit Trees Planted
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Fruit farms in the DPRK have planted fruit trees of good species in spring.
					 They, following the example of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, plan to put the fruit farming on a scientific, intensive and modern basis. They are now planting dwarf apple trees and pear, peach, apricot, plum and jujube trees.
					
					 The Kosan Fruit Farm has applied manure to hundreds of hectares, more than 100 tons per hectare, and planted dwarf apple trees in a scientific way.
					
					 After finishing a land rezoning project, the Hwangju Fruit Farm has transplanted high-yielding fruit trees on a large scale.
					
					 Fruit farms in South and North Phyongan, and South and North Hwanghae Provinces are working on digging pits and carrying compost to orchards.
					
					 The fruit tree planting is going on as scheduled in other fruit farms, too, including the Pukchong, Ryongjon, Toksong and Jongphyong Fruit Farms in South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Spring Herb Dishes
articles.content:
Spring Herb Dishes
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Dishes prepared with shovel weed, bamboo sprout, wormwood, giant garlic and other herbs are popular among people in the spring season as they are good for health.
					 Shovel weed soup helps prevent lethargy common in spring and promote digestion. It is also good for such diseases as dysentery, diarrhea and dropsy.
					
					 Bamboo sprout dish is efficacious for arteriosclerosis, myocardial infraction, diabetes, hypertension and headache.
					
					 Rice cake seasoned with fresh wormwood is one of the Korean people's favorite eats in spring as it takes a good effect on disease resulting from body chill and digestive trouble.
					
					 Giant garlic salad stimulates appetite with sweet and hot taste and fragrant smell. The dish has a special virtue for insomnia, female disorder and avitaminosis.

articles.title: Ancestral Mountain of Korea
articles.content:
Ancestral Mountain of Korea
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Mt. Paektu is the ancestral mountain of Korea.
					 All the mountain ranges stretch from Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The 2 750-meter-high mountain, the highest in the country, came into being through volcanic eruptions and evolution process.
					
					 The mountain has no similar in the country in view of geological features, natural environment, plants, animals and stream source.
					
					 The mountain appeared when torrents of lava poured forth a million years ago. Later, the volcano burst into eruption again, vomiting basalt to make a basaltic plateau called the Paektu lava plateau.
					
					 It, which had long been glaciated, spouted pumice stones several times.
					
					 Remarkable in the mountain scenery is the Lake Chon.
					
					 The water of the large lake is very clean.
					
					 The mountain consists of 216 peaks, including Janggun and Hyangdo Peaks.
					
					 The mountain is associated with the history of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle guided by President Kim Il Sung in the first half of the 20th century. It also has leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace.

articles.title: S. Korea: Vice-Minister's Remarks on Youth Issue Decried
articles.content:
S. Korea: Vice-Minister's Remarks on Youth Issue Decried
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea released a commentary on March 15 condemning deceptive remarks made by the vice-minister of Education, Science and Technology evading the responsibility for the youth issue.
					 The commentary said:
					
					 During a broadcasting program on March 12 he said that "education fund shall be turned into good account to relieve students of their burden of registration fee". He also said that "they will never make vain efforts if they do their best to learn just as a saying goes that heavy work in youth is quiet rest in old age".
					
					 The youth unemployment rate rises every year and the number of university students committing suicide weighed down by registration fee is on the increase. This is so deplorable reality.
					
					 The commitment to halve the registration fee made by the present chief executive during election campaign turned out to be a lie after three years, proving that it was only deceptive signboard to win in the election.
					
					 The vice-minister shifted the responsibility for the youth issue on to the university students, youth and people. He just resembles the present chief executive in impertinence.

articles.title: International Community Praises DPRK
articles.content:
International Community Praises DPRK
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The international community said with appreciation that the Korean people demonstrate their dignity as great and powerful people and the DPRK as a socialist land of Songun thanks to the treasured sword of single-minded unity.
					 Iran's newspaper The Iran News said that the single-minded unity serves as a basic factor helping the DPRK stand undeterred by any political hardships, a main source helping it work miracles previously considered impossible and a fundamental basis making it display powerful strength unafraid of any formidable rival.
					
					 The Russian newspaper Priamurskiye Vedomostsi said that the DPRK has unswervingly followed the path of socialism thanks to the harmonious whole of the leader and the people.
					
					 The Korean people have enshrined it as the faith through their life experience that only victory and glory are in store for them following their leaders, a bulletin of the Brazilian Working People's General Center said.
					
					 The chief of the UN Office at Geneva said that the DPRK is a country which achieved political stability and the single-minded unity of society, adding that it would have been unthinkable without the leadership ability of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The director general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the DPRK achieved a harmonious whole of the party, the army and the people unprecedented in the world history of politics.
					
					 The director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute said that Kim Il Sung's Korea would prosper forever and a drive for building a thriving nation will surely win a victory as there are the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il and the single-minded unity of the army and people united close around him.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea War Maneuvers Termed Criminal Act
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea War Maneuvers Termed Criminal Act
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The 10th issue of the Russian newspaper Patriot warned in a commentary that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities would be held wholly accountable for all the consequences to be entailed by their joint military maneuvers.
					 The U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises are a blatant challenge to the DPRK and an unpardonable criminal act of driving the situation to the brink of war again, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					 The joint saber-rattling is a very dangerous fuse which poses a grave threat to the DPRK and may spark off an all-out war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The prevailing situation proves that the south Korean authorities do not wish to improve the relations with the DPRK and preserve peace on the peninsula but are only pursuing confrontation and war against it.
					
					 The DPRK will strongly react against the vicious moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities to escalate confrontation and war rackets against it.

articles.title: Idea of "Jiwon" (Aim High) Praised
articles.content:
Idea of "Jiwon" (Aim High) Praised
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The Uruguayan paper La Juventud carried an article titled "The DPRK, idea of 'Jiwon' (Aim High)" on March 13. It carried a photo of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea.
					 The paper in an article said:
					
					 Kim Hyong Jik advanced "Aim High" the core of which is that "if I fall in battle, my son will continue the fight. And if my son fails to accomplish the cause, my grandson will carry it on until we win the country's independence".
					
					 He played the pioneer's role in changing the course of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea from the nationalist movement to the proletarian revolution.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung carried forward and developed the idea of "Aim High" and carved out the new road of the Korean revolution, the article said, elaborating on his feats for Korea's liberation.
					
					 The idea of "Aim High" is shining more brightly thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il, it said, adding:
					
					 This idea will shine forever with prosperous socialist Korea.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Stresses Significance of Sci-tech Innovation
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Stresses Significance of Sci-tech Innovation
Beijing, March 17 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao underscored the need to enhance the nation's capacity for scientific and technological innovation on March 14 when visiting an exhibition showcasing China's major scientific and technological achievements in the period of the 11th Five-Year Plan.
					 He said that "enhancing the country's sci-tech innovative capacity is the key to accomplishing the tasks of the 12th Five-Year Plan and taking the initiative in global competition."
					
					 He called on the scientists to strengthen scientific research in fundamental, cutting-edge and generic technologies and combine scientific and technological innovation with national economic and social development so as to offer science and technology support for China's building of an innovative country and adjustment to its economic growth mode.

articles.title: All Chinese Soldiers Urged to Study Spirit of NPC Session
articles.content:
All Chinese Soldiers Urged to Study Spirit of NPC Session
Beijing, March 16 (KCNA) -- The General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army on March 14 issued a notice to all its service persons to study the spirit of the Fourth Session of the 11th National People's Congress.
					 The notice underscored the need for the party committees and political bodies at all levels of the whole army and the armed police units to consider it as their immediate important political duty to inform their officers and men of the spirit of the recent session and let them study it. 
					
					 The notice stressed that they should put main emphasis on studying the important address made by President Hu Jintao at the plenary meeting of the CPLA delegation to the Fourth Session of the 11th NPC, pursuant to the unitary instruction given by the Central Military Commission, in particular.

articles.title: China's Foreign Ministry on Issue of Int’l Currency System Reform
articles.content:
China's Foreign Ministry on Issue of Int’l Currency System Reform
Beijing, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokeswoman for the Foreign Ministry of China at a press conference on Tuesday mentioned the issue of reforming the international currency system.
					 Referring to the symposium on the reform of the international currency system to be held in Nanjing on March 31, she said that the purpose of the symposium is to discuss the issue of reforming the international currency system, adding that the exchange rate of Renminbi was not on its agenda.
					
					 She dismissed as wrong the news report that China agreed to discuss the exchange rate of Renminbi at the symposium.

articles.title: Successful Modernization Drive in China
articles.content:
Successful Modernization Drive in China
Beijing, March 17 (KCNA) -- The Chinese people made progress in the modernization drive in the period of the 11th Five-Year Plan.
					 Last year the production of cement increased 1.8 times, the electricity output 1.7 times while coal and chemical fertilizer 1.4 times and 1.3 times each as against 2005.
					
					 Those in the agricultural field improved arable land with low yield and reinforced about 9 400 reservoirs in danger.
					
					 In the same period railways extending 16 000 km were built across the country.
					
					 Road network was formed in almost all rural areas amid a dynamic road pavement drive in the countryside.
					
					 Wharves were built at several ports and a total of 5 872 million tons of cargos were handled through major ports.
					
					 Depositing reservoirs and water pumping stations were built in rural areas across the country, making it possible to supply clean water to 215 million residents.
					
					 Forestation was briskly conducted everywhere, remarkably improving ecological environment.
					
					 Free compulsory education system was enforced in urban and rural areas, providing many children of school age with opportunities to learn. Clinics and hospitals were technologically updated or built.

articles.title: Russia Likely to Extend Ban on Food Export
articles.content:
Russia Likely to Extend Ban on Food Export 
Moscow, March 16 (KCNA) - The first vice-prime minister of Russia recently clarified that the term of the ban on food export might go on till the end of this year.
					 The government will decide this matter according to this year’s estimate of grain yield in the coming two months, he said. 
					
					 Russia banned the food export from Aug. 15 last year for the purpose of stabilizing the nation's food market and extended the term till Jun. 30 this year.

articles.title: Russia Not to Be Affected by Explosions at Japanese Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Russia Not to Be Affected by Explosions at Japanese Nuclear Power Plant
 Moscow, March 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Russian Atomic Energy Institute for Security and Development said at a recent press conference that Russia would not be affected by what happened at the Japanese nuclear power plant.
					 He held that even if the worst case took place at the power plant, Russian citizens would not suffer from radioactivity.
					
					 It was reported that the Far Eastern Region of Russia is monitoring day and night the effect of radiation materials leakage from the Japanese nuclear power plant and the radiation level in the region including Khabarovsk Territory and the Kuril Islands has not gone beyond limit.

articles.title: Australia's Childcare Service Fail on Hygiene, Safety and Education
articles.content:
Australia's Childcare Service Fail on Hygiene, Safety and Education
 Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Childcare centers in Australia are failing to meet learning, safety and hygiene standards, becoming a social issue.
					 Hundreds of childcare services in Australia are failing to meet basic hygiene, safety and education standards, a latest report by a council of the country showed Tuesday.

articles.title: Population Census Kicks Off in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Population Census Kicks Off in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Bangladesh's 5th population and household census commenced on Tuesday.
					 Under the five-day long census period, the total number of people living in the South Asian nation at present will be enumerated along with collection of concrete data on their age, sex, ethnicity, religion and social and economic status, the government of the country declared.

articles.title: Cuban Experts Reiterate Use of Nuclear Energy for Peaceful Purposes
articles.content:
Cuban Experts Reiterate Use of Nuclear Energy for Peaceful Purposes
Havana, March 16 (KCNA) -- Experts from the Higher Institute of Nuclear Sciences and Technologies of Cuba recently reiterated their commitment to continue using nuclear energy for peaceful purposes.
					 In a letter sent to the leader of the Cuban Revolution, Fidel Castro, they supported his reiterated warnings to the world about the danger of nuclear war. They expressed confidence that they would achieve greater successes in their researches.

articles.title: Brazilian President Calls for Denouncing Violence against Women
articles.content:
Brazilian President Calls for Denouncing Violence against Women
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff on Monday urged people to denounce violence against women in the country, which she said was "unacceptable."
					 During her weekly radio show, Rousseff stressed the importance of strictly following the Maria da Penha Law, which toughens the punishment for women abuse.

articles.title: Iran Denies Arming Afghan Militants
articles.content:
Iran Denies Arming Afghan Militants
Tehran, March 16 (KCNA) -- Iran has denied reports made by Western countries that the country has been offering arms to extremist groups in Afghanistan, a spokesman for Iran's Foreign Ministry told a press TV on Tuesday.
					 He said that Western countries were resorting to fabricating news and leveling false accusations against his country in order to divert public opinion's attention after their military invasion of Afghanistan proved ineffective.

articles.title: Iranian President Slams World Warmongers
articles.content:
Iranian President Slams World Warmongers
 Tehran, March 17 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad spoke strongly against the warmongering nations of the world, calling them devoid of care for humanity on March 12.
					 "The emptier their hearts are of affection, the more there are crime and war," the Iranian chief executive said.
					
					 "Warfare in Iraq and Afghanistan is an example, which has affected the economy and security of the whole world and everyone has suffered damage from it," the president said.
					
					 Ahmadinejad underlined that the world countries should make their best efforts to provide the ground for the establishment and prevalence of justice and a new world order.

articles.title: Lebanon Complains to UN over Israeli Violation of Regional Waters
articles.content:
Lebanon Complains to UN over Israeli Violation of Regional Waters
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- Lebanon filed a complaint on March 14 to the United Nations Security Council over the Israeli violation of its regional waters earlier this year.
					 The Lebanese Foreign Ministry said in a statement that an Israeli warship briefly entered Lebanon's regional waters on Feb. 2 and it opened fire with machine guns towards the Lebanese waters.
					
					 The complaint stated that this action is a "blatant violation of Lebanon's sovereignty, Security Council Resolution 1701, and the UN Charter."

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Killing of Afghan Civilians Condemned
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Killing of Afghan Civilians Condemned
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. armed forces stationed in Afghanistan have been condemned not only by the local inhabitants but the international community for their recent brutal crimes as aggressors. 
					 The March 1 air strike by the U.S. air force killed nine innocent children in Kunar Province of the country. 
					
					 The "anti-terrorism" operation conducted by the U.S. armed forces in the same province on February 20 left 64 civilians dead including women and children.

articles.title: LAS Accuses Israel of Expanding Jewish Settlements
articles.content:
LAS Accuses Israel of Expanding Jewish Settlements
Pyongyang, March 18 (KCNA) -- The League of Arab States on March 14 accused Israel of persistently expanding Jewish settlements.
					 The LAS branded the Israeli authorities' recent decision to build new Jewish settlements in Eastern Kuds as an action to turn the territory of Palestine into their colony.
					
					 The league called on the international community to pressurize the Israeli authorities to stop at once their expansion of Jewish settlements.

articles.title: XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- El XIII Festival de Kimilsungias dedicado al dia de nacimiento (15 de abril) del Presidente Kim Il Sung tendra lugar con solemnidad desde la segunda decada de abril en la capitalina Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias.
					　En el presente participaran las instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, los ministerios, los organos centrales, los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores de diversos estratos, la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon (Chongryon) y otras entidades de coreanos en ultramar, asi como los amigos extranjeros.
					
					　Durante el festival, tambien en varias localidades se efectuaran las exhibiciones de kimilsungias y se realizara la visita a los invernaderos de Kimilsungias y Kimjongilias.

articles.title: Embajador ruso ofrece banquete
articles.content:
Embajador ruso ofrece banquete
　Pyongyang, 18 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 62o aniversario de la concertacion del convenio sobre la cooperacion economica y cultural entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa, el embajador ruso en Corea, Valery Sukhinin, ofrecio el dia 18 un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
					  A la ocasion fueron invitados el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Mun Jae Chol y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes alli los miembros de la embajada rusa.
					
					  En el banquete hubo discursos.
